content.raw:
Part of the issue may be related [to this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/67/add-support-for-planes/diff#comment-79923948). The dartsim plugin implements the “plane” as a thin box, because I thought that’s what the SDF specification was demanding. Now that I know the size only pertains to rendering, I can change the dartsim plugin implementation to use a plane.

If my guess is correct, objects are more prone to sink into a thin box, because when you penetrate a thin box, the normal vectors of the penetration may be ambiguous, so the collision handler won’t know what direction to push the penetrating shape in. With a plane geometry, the normal vectors are never ambiguous, so you get more stable behavior.

I’ll give this theory a test and report back.
